comments.value:
Consolidate Tutorials and 2012 Tutorials

New screens:
- Publications, 
- Future opportunities
- ODA suppliers
- page locking and embargoing
- News and Media releases
- Blog, 
- Assigning stories
- Home page modules
- Scrolling feature modules

I think it's about half a day or so to add the new (and in some cases rearrange existing) topics. We can also add new ones on an ad hoc basis if the need arises.

I have set this as high priority with a due date of this time next week. Let me know if this is acceptable.

Is there any update on the completion of the Help screens?

-----Original Message-----
Sorry for confusion. It was waiting approval.
Sorry, do I have something to review now?
No. It was just awaiting your approval. The work will be done this week and I have set the due date as this time next week.
Permission to shift this work back to Wednesday, please.
Yes, that's okay

All done now. See http://postcms.zendesk.com/forums/61175-2012-tutorials/entries

The Help links inside the CMS (usually) go to the appropriate topic in Zendesk.

We will add new topics as and when needed, e.g. http://postcms.zendesk.com/entries/132532-replacing-automated-crops
Marking as solved.

Hi Any idea why the webcams keep getting stuck on a grey screen? I've noticed this happen a few times today particularly. They seem to work again when they refresh but doesn't look very good when they are grey. Thanks Alex http://www.london2012.com/webcams/velodrome.php http://www.london2012.com/webcams/olympic-village-looking-east.php Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Alex, I have had a look from my own computer and cannot replicate the problem. However, I think it is quite likely to be due to a slow-loading (or even stalled) image file.

If--as is quite likely--this is due to your own network at Canary Wharf, then maybe we shouldn't be too concerned (As it shouldn't effect other users outside the building). If, on the other hand, it is due to 2012 servers being slow, then this would definitely be a concern.

Please let me know if this continues to be a problem.

Update: ignore my previous response. The problem appears to be that some of the images are coming through to us in this state. It seems to  be only the occasional image and as we run the feed every hour, problem images are soon overwritten by a new image. If this continues to be an issue then it might be worth pursuing it with the people supplying the feed. [Thanks, Lars!]

Hi

 

Not sure if you know, but I have got this same email about four times! 

 

I’ve just got this one through again even though you sent it yesterday Danny. Perhaps there’s a glitch with the system?


Alex

Hi Finn,

Postcodes are a required field on registration so all users should 
have one (there may be some exceptions as I think there was a period 
when it wasn't compulsory)

Jamie
Sorry Finn, I missed the "NW1 and NW8?" bit off the end when I read the email.

Heh, no worries :-)

 

Any news on how long this might take?

 

________________________________
Finn, do you want "all users" or just those who have subscribed to a specific mailing list?
Sorry to chip in, but is it not just a filter on the database imported from the UMS in Communicator Corp?

Morag reckons we can actually, hadn't realised. I'll get back to you if
we don't have any success, thanks guys

 

 

________________________________

It's a bit trickier than it sounds, as you'll need to find a way of including 
 NW13AA & NW11AA
but EXCLUDING:
 NW112AA
I have already done this export for you, and can send it to you as soon as you've replied to:
> Finn, do you want "all users" or just those who have subscribed to a specific mailing list?

Thanks Kieran, if you've got it there I'll gladly accept the saved time
:-)

 

All users please

 

________________________________

Er, who's "saved time". Has Liz authorized this yet? (four of us have had a look at this ticket now and it's unlikely to be billable). Never mind. We are getting there!

'ASAP' does not mean anything unless Liz or Morag have authorized it.

I haven't sent anything yet.
Why do you think it's not billable?
Important to note that if they do it in Communicator, they'll get incorrect results.
Finn, are you SURE that you want email addresses of people who have not subscribed to any mailing list?

I thought you meant only people from specific mailing lists as opposed
to all mailing lists. No, we don't want to email people who aren't
subscribed to any list.

 

________________________________

I have marked this as billable.
This ticket was flagged as "ASAP today", so I thought it wise to address immediately. If this is NOT the case, then it would help if customers didn't decorate their ticket titles with such flags!
NB fwiw, 0.1 is now an underestimate, as I've just had to make another change.
Delivered via email.

Haven't received this Kieran?

 

________________________________

Odd; I sent you two emails at 15:52 this afternoon.
Will resend now.

Thanks Kieran, both have come through now.

Were there no NW8 registrations at all then? Spreadsheet only seemed to cover NW1-7


-----Original Message-----
Og crikey - I'll go and check now.

Side note: Janos has explained to me how to use the communicator interfaces and we should really not be getting these requests after this week. I am running a training session at LOCOG on Monday after which I am hoping they will start using the tools properly. Getting this data out should be trivial for them (I know, because I just tried it for the first time yesterday).
Re. side note: Did you see my comment re. NW1 vs NW11 ?

I went for something along the lines of  'begins with' nw8 or nw1 and 'does not begin with' nw10 and not nw11. Admittedly, this won't catch anyone in NW1 who has entered their postcode without a space in the middle, but there weren't very many of those, I think. I got 1332 subscribers in total.

Incidentally, there is a 'town' column which looks something like 'LONDON NW1', but is very incomplete. It looks like some kind of lookup has been done on it, but not very consistently.

We can suggest to them that we do some work in order to parse the postcodes.
We have a routine for doing so, that uses the "official" postcode regexp.
i.e. we can add two new fields to the user object:
  outcode (the first 2, 3, or sometimes 4, characters).
  incode (the last 3 characters)
which we populate when the user updates their profile.
They would then be able to search against this field in communicator.
My estimate is one day's work (my bit is prob just under a day, + Janos will need to change communicator stuff).
Worth suggesting to them?

Morag says the rows filled in with a 'Town' like "LONDON NW1" is a hangover from the data collected before we were involved and are no longer being used.

Morag and Finn now seem happy with the Communicator tools and are likely to use them from now on. 

We can probably mark this as solved.
Marked as solved.

Hi Morag, 

Quick update..

Have just chased eCommera for a test XML/RSS feed as we really need to get start on this soon if we are to have something up and tested in time.

thanks

Jamie

--

Hi Guys,

Just thought I catch up on the shop and next steps (technically)

As we discussed we're expecting to receive/parse an XML file (ie an RSS feed) on a daily basis that associates 'tags' with 'products' ie. something like this (not concerned about exact format):

<products>
	<product tag="homepage" gbpPrice="1.25" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Official pin</product>
	<product tag="potd1" gbpPrice="4.25" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Umbrella</product>
	<product tag="potd2" gbpPrice="8.00" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/346" >Pen</product>
	<product tag="potw1" gbpPrice="34.99" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Tee-shirt</product>
	<product tag="potw2" gbpPrice="32.00" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Tea cup</product>
	<product tag="Diving" gbpPrice="3.50" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Diving pin</product>
	<product tag="Running" gbpPrice="3.50" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Running pin</product>
</products>

Where potd1-4 / potw1-4 are the product of the days / week respectively, I'm not hung up on the names here, but it would be nice to have some kind of fall back products to show? Open to suggestions here / happy to go with whatever you offer out of the box.

The other more specific tags that we receive can then be editorially assigned to pages so that certain groups of products are displayed for those pages automatically.

However for Sports pages it would be /much better/ if we both shared the /same/ tags, therefore I have enclosed out Sports, Disciplines and Themes taxonomies.

Would it be possible to get an example of an XML/RSS feed of products (a test feed is fine) so that we can start the work on parsing it / generating the product / testing.

thanks

Jamie

Apologies for any inconvenience."

Registration for London 2012 Open Weekend starts today!

Open Weekend supported by BP is back for 2010
London 2012 invites you to take part in Open Weekend 2010, on 23-25
July. Join us to celebrate two years to go until the Olympic and
Paralympic Games!

Last year over 470 organisations hosted 800 events across the UK; 90% of
organisations surveyed said their event attracted new audiences. Watch
the 2009 celebrations

SJlFrKFs/> 

Be part of Open Weekend in 2010 and celebrate with hundreds and
thousands of people across the UK. This year we are inviting Local
authorities, sporting and cultural organisations and venues across the
UK to set a challenge for the public to participate in. The challenge
could be to create a new piece of art in 24 hours, organise a treasure
hunt or stage a mass aerobics session - it's entirely up to you.

Who can be involved?
London 2012 Open Weekend is open to organisations and venues from the
world of culture and sport. We ask that your event:
- Sets a challenge that the public can participate in 
- Takes place between 23-25 July 2010 
- Is non-commercial and not-for-profit
- Does not have any commercial sponsorship or offer any similar
marketing rights 
- Is open to everyone

How to register your event

visit london2012.com/openweekend

SJlFrKFs/> . Registration will close at 12 noon on 16 July 2010.

in Open Weekend. Workshops will be held in:
Birmingham - 25 February 
Leeds - 16 March
Bristol - 22 March
Southampton - 26 March
London - 13 April

To book a place on one of the workshops or for any queries regarding
Open Weekend please contact us at openweekend@london2012.com

Hi Alex,

If you give one a value of 1000 it should go above all the others 
(although you will need to take the 1000 off it and assign it a lower 
value when you want another one to be the top one)

There isn't any way in the CMS of shuffling order (say in the browse 
interface) if that is what you mean.

We could maybe have a check box to indicate the top webcam (but if two 
webcams both have the box checked it won't work, much like having two 
webcam pages with a nav-order of 1000)
Jamie, you mean a value of 1000 beats a value of 1 so that the higher the index the higher up the page it goes? (a bit counter intuitive)

Hi Liz,

I responded to Morag's ticket on this earlier..
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/795

To-recap what I said over in that ticket.

- In terms of spoofing emails, we only allow one email to be sent per
IP address per hour (actually you may be able to send more than one if
you use web01 and then web02 up to a maximum of 6 if you managed 
by a massive stoke of luck to hit web01-06 in sequence).

- In terms of 'injecting rogue code' / 'beign insecure' we strip out any HTML mark up
(or rather escape it) and the email is sent as a plain text so no
email client should be rendering the HTML? So not sure where the "Apparently it's not secure" comes from?

Although I do agree that if the service isn't being used much and you
would rather play it safe (and obviously the less points of attack the
better) then it may be sensible to remove it completely.

However this does leave the question of what goes in the place of it?

Should we just move the Share on Regit/Digg/Stumble links up the 3rd
column and leave the rest of the space on the right empty of now?

Obviously there is going to be a small amount of work (1-2 hrs) involved in re-coding that markup / CSS / republishing pages etc. (and as far as I am aware what is there at the moment is not inherently insecure, although as I said I do understand why you may prefer not to have it as a possible point of attack if it's not really used) never the less I think we probably will have to charge for  time spend removing it or re-jigging the CSS/markup.

Let us know if your happy to go with the suggestion above of dropping the email box and moving the digg/stumble links up to a 3rd column.

thanks

Jamie

Ah, sorry Jamie - I hadn't realised Morag sent this through!

 

But yes, I think that moving the digg/reddit/stumbleupon to the third
column is the best option! 

 

Thanks,

 

Liz
